oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Using Student Volunteers in Library Orientations
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Anders, Kathy Christie
German, Elizabeth M.
Graves, Stephanie J.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: student volunteers
orientation
library programming
engagement
outreach
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Student volunteers can be a valuable resource for library outreach programming. This article details how our library leveraged several registered student organizations (RSOs) to create our freshman orientation video and staff our library open house. Using student volunteers in orientation events helped reduce library anxiety among student participants, engage our freshman audience, and create meaningful connection between library services and campus life.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: Practical Academic Librarianship: The International Journal of the SLA Academic Division; Vol. 6 No. 2 (2016); 17-30
